name: Touchdown Chili
author: Jenn Polk
summary: Every year when football season rolls around and the weather begins to cool, my husband requests I make this hearty, beanless chili. It receives rave reviews from everyone.
ingredients: 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice
1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers, drained
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer
directions: Place the ground beef, onion and garlic in a large saucepan over medium heat
Cook, stirring to crumble the beef, until the beef is no longer pink and the onion is tender
Drain off the fat and return the pan to the stove
Combine the chili powder, cumin and basil; sprinkle over the beef
Cook and stir to coat the meat and toast the spices a little
Pour in the tomatoes, green chilies, tomato sauce, beer and vinegar
Bring to a boil and stir to loosen any bits that are stuck to the bottom of the pan
Mix in the brown sugar, hot pepper sauce, salt and pepper
Reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 3 hours
Remove the lid for the last 30 minutes of cooking
